instructions_to_main_agent: Initialize the frontend using Vite + React + Tailwind + TypeScript (if allowed, otherwise JS).
Install 'shadcn-ui' components (button, card, input, table, badge, dialog, select, tabs, form, sonner, scroll-area).
Install 'recharts' for data visualization (Pipeline stats, ML metrics).
Install 'reactflow' for the ETL Pipeline visualizer (DAG view).
Use the 'dark' class on the html element by default.
Implement a Sidebar layout (Left fixed sidebar, main content area on right).
Use the Bento Grid layout for the Dashboard Overview.
Ensure the 'Logs' viewer uses a monospaced font and dark background to mimic a terminal.
For the 'Experiments' page, use a dense table layout to compare metrics across many runs.
IMPORTANT: Do not use gradients for backgrounds. Keep them solid dark (#09090b) or very subtle noise if needed.
Use the provided image URLs only for the Login page or specific 'Visual' cards. Do not clutter the main dashboard with images.
universal_guidelines: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
